website_summaries.verdict: A few faults aside -- including difficult cleanup and inconsistent results -- it is a high-performing product at an affordable price.
pros: Fine, medium, and coarse blades yield different consistencies

customer_reviews.title: Made apple sauce with it and it worked good. My only complaint is that you need to ...
customer_reviews.text: Made apple sauce with it and it worked good. My only complaint is that you need to use a very deep bowl because the "ears" that sit on top of the bowl are mounted too high. On our old food mill the "ears" are mounted lower allowing you to use a shallower bowl. See photo for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Grimes Jr.

customer_reviews.title: No more seeds in my jam!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help process blackberries for jam. It worked well. There are three mill plates. The smallest plate worked well to take out the blackberry seeds. I also have used it on concord grapes, applesauce, and tomatoes. If you occasionally can, get this product. If you are processing large bundles of tomatoes, you might want something else that has a motor, or can easily handle larger quantities. But, for a typical batch of seven or so half pints, this is a very economical product that works well.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Very inexpensive but surprisingly good quality
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid that this very cheap food mill wouldn't be of very good quality, but I was pleasantly surprised. The white plastic body is actually quite tough and we have had not cracks or chips after more than a month of daily use making meat and vegetable purees for baby food. There is a small card with a few rudimentary instructions, but no real manual. Assembly is easy if you remember that the screens must be installed concave side down. Also, we have found that it is helpful to give 3 or 4 turns in the normal direction, then half a turn in the "wrong" direction, to clear the screen.
customer_reviews.author: The Prof

customer_reviews.title: doesnt scrape over the screen well
customer_reviews.text: it did what i needed done but not without a lot of work helping it do its job. the scraper doesnt make good contact with the screen. It contacts at some points but not others on both the screen and the scraper. Tried adjusting it but no luck. As a result it prob took 3x as long to process the seeds out of my black berries to make jam. That being said it beat trying to mash the seeds out by hand which i was doing. If anyone has any suggestions on how to make both surfaces make continuous contact, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: R. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: very hard to work with impossible to turn
customer_reviews.text: I finally got a chance to use this and was excited to be able to make my own passata,,, how disappointing it was that I have to go out and buy a new one,,, after assembling with the disk i wished to use, it would not turn,,,, the springs must have been too tight and the top part of the device was jammed up against the side and simply would not budge,, it seemed the whole thing was off,, i finally used another disk,,, i tried all three, and it was impossible to use,,, i ended up getting some tomato juice and finally gave up,, now I am sitting on 12 lbs of cooked tomatoes until a get another one!
customer_reviews.author: donna haeni

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and effective
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews and decided on this food mill for processing my tomatoes into juice. It really did the job. It’s sturdy and easy to assemble and clean. I took that flimsy mill back to Wal-Mart (it was the only one they offered). Very satisfied with this mill!
customer_reviews.author: BeenThere

customer_reviews.title: This Food Mill is fantastic! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I owned this same one for at least 15 years and it makes the smoothest mashed potatoes ever! Easy to use, works great and very easy to clean. The spring finally gave out on my old one so I decided to order a new one. Was happy to see I could get the same one. Fits bowls of many different sizes due to the feet. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product; cut my worktime by hours
customer_reviews.text: I had a giant garden and bumper fruit crop this year and have now made dozens of 1/2 pint, pint, and quart jars of sauces and fruit products. I purchased this mill in the hopes of removing the bitter peels and seeds in an easier manner that I usually do. I still work full time so any item that will save me wasted time is worth a reasonable investment. I love this item. Made out of good materials, easy to use and clean. I have used it now for several weeks of processing and canning and can give this product an excellent review. Wish I had purchased one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Kim OHair

customer_reviews.title: Really useful kitchen accessory for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make applesauce with my kids after an apple picking outing. You can chop up the apples with skins on, simmer 15 minutes, and put them right through the mill with the medium blade. They had a lot of fun and we froze 8 jars of applesauce in a quick afternoon project. Have since used it to make smooth mashed potatoes and pumpkin puree for pie - no peeling! Love it
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Missing instructions
customer_reviews.text: Have not tried product yet, it may be fine. However, the nox looked like it had been opened, and the instructions and recipes were missing.
customer_reviews.author: The Grimster

customer_reviews.title: This thing worked beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: I really thought I was going to have to return it and get a more expensive model I had seen, but this thing worked BEAUTIFULLY! I had tons of cherry and grape tomatoes that were about to go bad, and I decided to make marinara with them. I ended up with too much skin and was about to throw the 2 jars away. Instead, I ordered this food mill and gave it a try. In just a couple of minutes I had all the tomato skin in the mill and a sauce that still had texture in the bowl. So happy! I highly recommend this food mill.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Perez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and disassemble, dish-washer safe, and fun to use
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it is well made, not difficult to take apart and makes great applesauce and puree. It's so easy to disgard peel and seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Ellen Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality material.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality material, sturdy, easy to take apart and put back together. It does not have a cheap aluminium feel to it. I like this part. I only wish it was more stable as a "stand alone", as it needs to rest on a pot, a pan, or a bowl because of its design and the weight of the handle. I have used it to mash potatoes, applesauce, and other cooked veggies and fruit and it did an excellent job.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence L.

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: Some of the low-rated reviews made me nervous but decided it was worth a try. It's fine. Not quite as good as the old metal ricer I used to have (I particularly miss the wire sweep on the bottom) and it took a bit of muscle to lock the blade in place, but overall it works well and I'm glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Grazillda

customer_reviews.title: Top rated by America's Test Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: If you are unfamiliar with ATK, think of them as Consumer Reports dedicated to food and food preparation only. Never once have I found ATK's top-rated items to be less than exemplary. So to find a replacement for my 50+ year-old food mill was an obvious choice. If I had to come up with a draw back, assembling the item is not the easiest for this aging person.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Robbins

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst food mill ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst food mill ever. When I make applesauce, the skins slip through around the edges of the hole attachment. I am so frustrated, picking all the skins out of the applesauce. It should have a gasket around the edge. I am going to toss it out and buy something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Works terribly/ does't work. Wastes the majority of the food by just spinning around.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: I like that it has 3 different grater size attachments and ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made.... I like that it has 3 different grater size attachments and I like that it is made of stainless steel and easy to clean. Just waiting for apple season to use it. I was going to use it to skin tomatoes but decided it was just as easy to stick them in boiling water for a few seconds and peel them. I think I just need a few more ideas as to what to use my product on...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to crush and mill canned plum tomatoes for sauce. Doesn't take long for the blade to just push the tomatoes around without crushed or juicing them. Has become useless.
customer_reviews.author: Smod

customer_reviews.title: Works great for getting the seeds out of Blackberry & Strawberry jam.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Food Mill for use in making jam because my hubby doesn't like the seeds in fruit jams. I've used it on blackberry jam and strawberry jam and it does an amazing job straining the fruit. Highly recommend for anyone making fruit jams. I know this Food Mill has a myriad of other uses, but I haven't tried it for anything other than making jam so far.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for sturdiness. It was so sturdy I couldn’t take it apart to clean! Too late to return. It locked up on me when trying to change plates. Ended up throwing it away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This appliance far exceeded my expectations in both quality and performance. It is one of my most valued kitchen appliances and I have many.
customer_reviews.author: marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for making sauces
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Easy to use and clean. I usually end up with tons of tomatoes at the end of the summer and am forced to make sauce in large batches. This tool is perfect. I can cook, strain, and reduce the sauce SO MUCH FASTER once I started using the food mill. It is easy to disassemble for cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean. Took me a few tries to assemble correctly. Disappointed the handle split on the backside after just one use.
customer_reviews.author: Emelie Konopka

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for purposes
customer_reviews.text: This is a womderful stainless steel kitchen product. Unfortunately it did not work for me as I hoped it would. I want to separate fruit from seeds and have used it for lilikoi, suriname cherries and mysore raspberries. It just does not work for that purpose. I would have been better off with a traditional cone shaped ricer. The spinning part does not come in close enough contact with the screens.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Noel

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together and to clean
customer_reviews.text: I love this strainer/softer. I would be lost without it in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Gena Fabiani

customer_reviews.title: Takes some patience
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mill to process tomatoes from my garden, removing skin and seeds. It did so, but it took a long time--lots of cranking and re-positioning the food. I'm looking forward to next growing season when I'll be using it for more different types of produce. If you don't mind spending time, you get good results. If you're in a hurry, you'd probably do better to get a powered food mill.
customer_reviews.author: judith blair

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this was rated as a good product by Americas test kitchen. I tried milling some canned tomatoes and even with that I had to push them under the blade. The blade is too small to catch the food and there is no friction between the blade and the milling plate. What a piece of garbage and a waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works but too samll
customer_reviews.text: THis works well but the circumfrance is too small for most bowls. Also the depth of the unit severly limits the amount that can be put inot the bowl. I used it to make applesauce (I make about 8 quarts at a time) and I had to use a small plastic (1 quart) bowl that I could only fill 3/4 of the way. This slowed down my production too much so I went and got an OXO brand from BBAB. Cost a little more but worked out in my application much better (it spans an 8 quart Pyrex glass bowl)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I have used this more than I expected to. It is sturdy and easy to clean. Other reviews have mentioned the size as too small, but unless you are making gallons of something the is size is perfectly adequate. I use mine mostly for processing garden produce for canning/freezing but I believe this would be an exceptional tool for making your own baby food.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this mill
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this mill. Large capacity, quiet. Was able to run 3 cups of berries through the mill at one time with out needing to stop and rinse screen before doing more. Grooved feet allow it to grip various size bowls. Cleaned up easily. Once you get the hang of it, changing screens is not difficult - just a little tight, which is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: AutumnT

customer_reviews.title: Good Compact Product. Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Very good, especially for the price. I've been using it to process all of my garden tomatoes for freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Rossputin

customer_reviews.title: High quality stainless steel make this food mill hard to ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality stainless steel make this food mill hard to beat! Comes with everything in the picture, and even a recipe book to get the full use of the product. We have had food mills in the past but this one is made to last and I would imagine it will be the last one we ever need to purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: So cheap  - not worth a penny
customer_reviews.text: What a lousy product. It is so cheaply made and I ended up having to push tomatoes through. Waste of $24.99.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: It works but stains easily
customer_reviews.text: It worked well; however , the plastic stained the very first time I used it. I made tomato sauce and the bottom stained red. Overall it does the job but I kinda wish I went with a metal one. The base is nice and wide to fit over most bowls.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: I make applesauce frequently, and have been using food mill dating to 1936. This one works quite a bit better and I don't have to worry about rusting parts. My only objection is that it takes up a lot of storage space.
customer_reviews.author: LICOOK

customer_reviews.title: Good but overprized
customer_reviews.text: The Mill work perfect and is nice looking. The only thing is that is small for the price. more then $40 for this size mill is way overpriced
customer_reviews.author: Gaetano Scollo

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for occasional use... I pick a lot of wild blackberries in the summer I have processed about 20 pounds of berries so far using this... and it kicks butt over using a sieve works great... cleans easily.... to those of you complaining about it grinding.... you have the screen in upside down!
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: Performs well and a good value
customer_reviews.text: The RSVP is easy to use, does its job very well, and is easy to clean. A great food mill for under $25. No wonder Cook's Illustrated rated it #1.
customer_reviews.author: Randy G.

customer_reviews.title: useless. Only sorry I waited so long to get ...
customer_reviews.text: I finally had a chance to use this, the pusher blade doesn't touch the plate, therefore, useless. Only sorry I waited so long to get to it because now I can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Litreader

customer_reviews.title: incomplete delivery
customer_reviews.text: Received today. Box appeared to have been opened before. Was supposed to come with instructions and recipes, but neither were included in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Janikowski

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last long.
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing last year for thanksgiving and intermediate use throughout the year it stopped working. Maybe warping in the plastic? Pulled it out this thanksgiving thinking my potato’s would be a breeze. Couldn’t get it to turn. Sprinting for a better mill that’s stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Lady in the Chi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Fits many size bowls and is stable in the way it interfaces. The wide opening is fantastic for loading the hopper without spilling. The handle has a nice large nob that's easy to grip. Easy to clean. Three size grates are perfect for processing a variety of foods.
customer_reviews.author: NorEaster

customer_reviews.title: i like that there are grooves on the legs to help ...
customer_reviews.text: this works well. i used it many times this fall when i made applesauce. i like that there are grooves on the legs to help it stay secure on the bowl when turning the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to make pear butter It worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: works great.
customer_reviews.text: I am a retired chef and I was a bit concerned with this being plastic that it would break or not hold up well. I was really wrong! It works great! I use it for doing jellies and tomatoes with no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Flo

customer_reviews.title: ... for America's Test Kitchen Garlic Mashed Potatos for the perfect
customer_reviews.text: Use it for America's Test Kitchen Garlic Mashed Potatos for the perfect texture
customer_reviews.author: Janet P.

customer_reviews.title: Very handy kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: I have been using an upright funnel shaped sieve to make tomato juice, and that works well, but this is quicker to use and way quicker to clean. The best part is that is does a lot of other things too, I've even riced potatoes with it and creamed split pea soup when the last of the peas didn't cook completely down. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia K. Kearney

customer_reviews.title: Endurance Food Mill
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just a little clumsy to use as it scoots around when you turn the blade. However it does a great job and made my canning go a lot quicker this year.
customer_reviews.author: Harleybabe5772

customer_reviews.title: it worked great. Used it to make some apple butter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with a group of items that I purchased to start my new hobby - canning. I used it once, and while it took me a minute or two to figure out how it is assembled, it worked great. Used it to make some apple butter, and it was perfect consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this food mill because I have an abundance of apples and wanted to try canning apple sauce. This food mill works great. It's sturdy and easy to use. My apple sauce came out great. I highly recommend this product. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: MoodyBarbie59

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of apples to use up and couldn't face peeling them all. This food mill was exactly what I needed - I just cut and cored the apples, boiled them, put them through the food mill and had some delicious applesauce to show for it - without peeling a single apple!
customer_reviews.author: alisheng

customer_reviews.title: It works I guess
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly I am not an expert. This was my first time at using a food mill and it didn't do what I wanted it to do .... thin out chunky salsa ... it just left the chunks in the holder and all I got was juice
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Kirkendall

customer_reviews.title: and it is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to crash veggies to my son. Now, when he is older and has his own teeth to chew, we use it for homemade pasta sauces, and it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Olena

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this food mill primarily to remove seeds from blackberries and black raspberries for jam making. I have not tried it for that yet. I love it for applesauce and apple butter though. I wish I purchased this sooner. It is sturdy plastic, washes easily and was a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Katie M

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to clean, light weight and does the job just fine. If it was a little easier to take apart and put back together I would have given it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kline

customer_reviews.title: It did exactly what I needed, separated the tomato ...
customer_reviews.text: It did exactly what I needed, separated the tomato skin/seeds from the juice so I could can some tomato sauce.
customer_reviews.author: smart shopper

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: Very affordable and easy to use. This was my first attempt at making homemade tomato sauce and I needed to find a food mill quickly and also reasonably priced and this was the perfect mill
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Food Mill
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for one of these for quite a while and when I got this one was very happy that I ordered it. I like the 3 different blade sizes, which you don't get with most food mills I've seen. It's sturdy and well made and is an excellant mill for the money. Would recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Jodrey-Byam

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel food mill
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. It comes with 3 different mills, and is very durable and effective. Easy to use.....worth the price, and much less expensive than ones in stores that don't offer 3 mills.....I would recommend to anyone with a need to mill any type of food
customer_reviews.author: Becky Marsland-Hill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to use and clean. Made great applesauce!
customer_reviews.author: Schoonie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Food Mill
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy design. A very good food mill that does exactly what it is supposed to do. Makes excellent whipped potatoes. Don't be fooled by the plastic look, it is very sturdy and fits over most sauce pans.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: After dealing with flimsy kitchen equipment this mill is a tank!! The gauge on this mill is more than enough for a commercial kitchen. The Mill has a solid feel that you just don't see alot of in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good product, works well
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. I've made tomato juice with it as well as rice mashed potatoes. It is small but works very very well.
customer_reviews.author: NCSong

customer_reviews.title: Food mill.
customer_reviews.text: Received this food mill hoping that the picture did it justice. It did! Will hold up to 3 to 4 cups of food to be processed. Works wonderful, and so easy to clean. If you purchase, you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Frances M. Berube

customer_reviews.title: You can't beet this for making apple sauce.
customer_reviews.text: Quality heavy duty stainless steel. A fine piece of cooking equipment. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Flamethrower

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work week for tomato sauce
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried the othe disks. It's a good thing this wasn't too expensive because it sure didn't meet my needs
customer_reviews.author: Pamela H.

customer_reviews.title: Best mashed potatoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perefectly for mashed potatoes! it didn't quite fit on the pan I was using, but I was able to use a little shim to hold it in place. Worked perfectly and cleaned up well. Great product and a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Always Sunny

customer_reviews.title: The service was great, I received it the day after I ordered ...
customer_reviews.text: The resting prongs are a bit to long and it makes it difficult to store it so I just keep it in the box and store it in the garage. The service was great, I received it the day after I ordered it. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Melody Foley

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed. Or maybe its just too complicated for me brain.
customer_reviews.text: Either I can't figure this thing out, or it doesn't work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice for the price. Assembly Instructions could have been clearer. White Plastic STAINS if you are doing tomatoes. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Brown Buffalo

customer_reviews.title: Food Mill is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a food mill before but I do A LOT of canning and I have seen it suggested in canning recipes so I decided to buy one. OMG!! The thing is amazing! Such a simple device but what a time saver. I had 1.5 bushels of tomatoes to can and with the food mill, there was no need to blanch and peel and seed the tomatoes. The food mill took care of it. My tomato sauce is the best ever!! I can't wait to use it again when I make tomato soup tomorrow. I would highly recommend this if you do alot of cooking from scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Burns

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Used for canning and did not like that the plastic stained with use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! I made 20 quarts of tomato juice with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, was making tomato sauce for canning
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, was making tomato sauce for canning. Very easy to use, removed all the skins and 95 percent of the seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Pat McGuire

customer_reviews.title: It is totally useless. Amazon says it is too late to return
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a birthday present for my wife. It is totally useless. Amazon says it is too late to return. I could not make it work for her. Do NOT waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Ex Doc

customer_reviews.title: Clunky and ineffective
customer_reviews.text: The finest mesh isn't fine enough for mashed potatoes (they still need to be mashed afterwards with something else), and that was the only vegetable I could make pass through, still with a lot of it retained between the mesh and the blade. Other vegetables less rich in starch, like pumpkin, even after very well cooked, wouldn't go through even the coarser mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio Ceconello

customer_reviews.title: so useful
customer_reviews.text: i really enjoy this produce just for the creamy mashed potatoes it makes. no mess and divine every time. also enjoy the homemade applesauce. i look forward to other ways of using this product. very easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Keg

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is well-made and will be useful for small jobs. It just isn't efficient enough for any bulk processing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K. Barber- W7OLA

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice. It made a very nice Christmas gift. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Degarlais

customer_reviews.title: Great for applesauce and tomato sauce for canning
customer_reviews.text: Great for applesauce and tomato sauce for canning!! Easy to use, clean! Fit all of the bowls and pans that I have used. Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: manik

customer_reviews.title: I like this food mill very much
customer_reviews.text: I like this food mill very much. I use it primarily for applesauce.It is easy to handle,rinses out in a jiffy. The only problem I have is it takes strength to assemble the handle, but I am not as strong as I used to be, goldie lefkowitz, kailua-kona,hi
customer_reviews.author: goldie lefkowitz

customer_reviews.title: Must have if making apple sauce.
customer_reviews.text: Had great America's test kitchen recipe that advises to cook apples with peel on which adds favor. But then removing peels would be a chore without the Rotary food mill. 3 different attachments made for a variety of textures for your preference. Look forward to using it for other foods as well. Well designed at reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Janice B

customer_reviews.title: FOOD MILL
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT GRAB FOOD TO MILL VERY WELL. YOU HAVE TO CONSTANTLY PUSH THE FOOD UNDER THE BLADE, AND IT IS A VERY SLOW PROCESS. RETURNED IT FOR CREDIT.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: used to puree applesauce and a red pepper puree and ...
customer_reviews.text: used to puree applesauce and a red pepper puree and the food mill performed just as expected. No problems, east to clean.
customer_reviews.author: S & P

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Such a handy tool to have - easy to use, Does a great job with mashed potatoes!
customer_reviews.author: MGF

customer_reviews.title: Great Food Mill
customer_reviews.text: This is a great food mill and so easy to use and it does such a great job of removing the majority of the blackberry seeds from the blackberry jam I am canning.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Does't grate it all
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work so great and it leaves about 1/4 of the potatoes unable to grate.
customer_reviews.author: J J C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect for preparing tomatoes for sauces. No boiling of tomatoes, and peeling skin Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Ruotolo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, reliable
customer_reviews.text: The logo on the handle washed off but that’s the only issue I’ve had
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Le

customer_reviews.title: Makes mashing  several potatoes much easier
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact I could do more than one potato at time to mash.
customer_reviews.author: corinna c.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for making jam, but not as well when used on tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Shell.

customer_reviews.title: No more squissing by hand
customer_reviews.text: Very surprising and pleased about the quality of this product, does San Marzsano Tomatoes justice.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gioia

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I like it, it's easy to clean and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: LvD

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: Mother-in-law showed me hers, and I had to have one. I am quite happy with it, as it saves me a lot of time and effort, especially when making mashed potatoes or hash browns. Well made and pretty sturdy. Great bargain, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: HE Crooks

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product!! It's always been a necessary item in my kitchen and, since my old one got damaged, i've been looking to buy a new one almost everywhere. The service was great, the shipment quick and smooth; the item arrived even before the date that was indicated at the time of the order.Overall, i'm very satisfied - both with the product and with the overall service - and i will definitely purchase more items!
customer_reviews.author: Ely

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Affordable Food Mill
customer_reviews.text: Super affordable, and very easy to change the blades. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Once I figured it out it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple of times of trying it because it came with now instructions for which foods to use for which blades. Once I figured it out it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Apple Butter Heaven
customer_reviews.text: This simple mill made the process of creating apple butter easy! We used it during this recipe: [...] and it turned out AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: C. Pultz

customer_reviews.title: RSVP Endurance SS Food Mill
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the wife. She says it is really heavy-duty and will last forever. She plans to give it to one of our girls when the time comes. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Va Trail Rider
